comments:
PerformanceMonitorLinux now has an elapsed time metric.  However, it currently
does not work well when not run as a plug-in test.  The attached patch fixes
this for me.

Created an attachment (id=19033)
Patch to org.eclipse.test.performance

Biily, I don't understand what the problem is and why your patch fixes it.
Could you please shed some light on it?
Thanks.

Sorry.

When I run the SWT performance tests as a JUnit test, I get the following
assertion failure.  What is happening is that even if eclipse.startTime is not
set, addScalar() is called once with the current time, but not a second time. 
This leaves the dimension with only one valid value.  If I run the SWT
performance tests as a JUnit plug-in test, it works fine, since
eclipse.startTime is set.

The patch fixes it so that elapsed time is simply never reported if
eclipse.startTime is not set.

junit.framework.AssertionFailedError: reference has no value for dimension

Thanks Billy, I've fixed the problem in HEAD as well as the three branches.
It should appear in today's nightly build.
